_comment: Created by ianb on 16/12/2014 11:18:19 using v2.3
title: How have emergency admissions for children with lower respiratory tract infections changed over time?
analysis_commentary: Emergency admissions for children with lower respiratory tract infections is an indicator for measuring Domain 3 of the NHS Outcomes Framework - Helping people to recover from episodes of ill health or following injury - and it should not usually require a hospital admission. We see that the rate of emergency admissions has declined between 2010/11 and 2011/12 (from 379 to 356 per 100,000) but again increased in 2012/13 to 400 per 100,000.
data_source: NHS Outcomes Framework, Health and Social Care Information Centre
